page.title: 01Lower Darwen.Main Features.
page.content: This is an area of wide diversity situated between the towns of {Blackburn and Darwen. The character of the area changes with the contours. In the valley there are the remnants of old established industries such as cotton and paper mills. Higher up the valley sides new industries have been built on greenfield sites. These include carpet manufacturers, the largest steel stockholders in the World and light engineering factories. Higher still, on the moorland,hill farming continues with little change over the years. New housing estates have been built to replace large areas of terraced housing which formerly served the cotton mills, but many terraced areas still survive.
